intro: Armeria matritensis, commonly known as the Spanish thrift, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant features dense clusters of small, white or pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Armeria matritensis is well adapted to rocky and coastal environments, thriving in full sun and well-drained soils.
